issues.title: Support for KWallet
issues.body: Unfortunately, KWallet, the KDE equivalent to GNOME Keyring, does not support the freedesktop secrets standard. KDE Wallet does have [an api](https://api.kde.org/frameworks/kwallet/html/index.html), though. Can someone implement this, so KDE users won't have to install GNOME Keyring?

issues.title: Password forgotten after logging out/in or reboot
issues.body:
Pithos will remember my password until the system reboots, after which I need to sign in again.  Interestingly, it always remembers my email address.

How can I troubleshoot this? Not sure what other information to provide.

Pithos version: 1.3.1
System: Gentoo
DE/WM: KDE/Kwin

issues.title: HeaderBar
issues.body:
In the course of the ongoing redesigning of Pithos the decision was made to more closely follow the Gnome Shell HIG. While in many ways this is a good thing, one feature of the Gnome Shell HIG, the HeaderBar, will cause Pithos to look out of place on any Desktop Environment other that Gnome.

In an effort to ensure that Pithos does not lose favor with non-Gnome users I took it upon myself to find a way for the HeaderBar to be used without the unfortunate side effects. I believe I have done so.

I have written a wrapper around HeaderBar, with an almost one to one API, that will allow for HeaderBar to be enabled/disabled with one function call and no duplicated code. I have released this wrapper under GPL 2 and request that the Pithos community look into using either it or the ideas it is built upon.

Wrapperbar: https://github.com/ForLoveOfCats/wrapperbar

issues.title: Keyring issue with KDE on Wayland
issues.body:
I'm starting the move to KDE on Wayland, but Pithos isn't running because of a keyring issue. I have the keyring unlocked (SDDM unlocks libsecret "login" on login), and it works just fine in X. Here's the Error Dialog Text:

**Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached**
    You need to install a service such as gnome-keyring

And here's the log running from the command line:
```
ERROR - util:on_get_finish:88 - Failed to get Secret.Service, Error: g-io-error-quark: Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached (24)
ERROR - pithos:on_keyring_unlocked:280 - You need to install a service such as gnome-keyring. Error: g-io-error-quark: Error calling StartServiceByName for org.freedesktop.secrets: Timeout was reached (24)
```
I'd really appreciate a fix for this, since I'd like to use Plasma on Wayland as much as I can.

issues.title: Missing Volume Icon
issues.body: I'm using latest Git from the AUR. The volume icon is a question mark. I'm on Manjaro KDE. Is this just an issue trying to access the wrong resource via GTK, or something on my end?

issues.title: Hide Statusbar
issues.body:
Alright, so I did a quick search through issues, and found #81. It didn't have much about the statusbar, and I didn't read through the whole thing, but I didn't get much on this.

Basically I'm wondering what would be required to hide the statusbar when it's not in use. For example, when pithos is "Getting Songs", the statusbar would be shown, but just about any other time it's empty and eating up space. I'm not familiar with Gtk, or its documentation. What would be required to do this?

issues.title: Play Next in song context menu
issues.body: Sometimes I want to not play a song in a playlist without necessarily giving it a negative rating or sleeping it. Maybe I just like a song after it in the playlist better and would rather hear it next? I'm not suggesting that we should be able to play a playlist out of order or have a proper play queue, not that there would even be a point to that with only at most 5 songs to pick from. I just think it would be nice to just be able to click an upcoming song in a playlist and say play this one next.

issues.title: Window sizing edge case with Wayland on GNOME after unmaximizing
issues.body:
If you maximize Pithos and then "hide" it to a MPRIS widget(or also I assume the notification icon?) and then show it again and unmaximize it the window goes to it's minimum size.
![screenshot from 2017-11-25 08-40-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6667703/33231546-66685528-d1bc-11e7-9e0b-a6c087e916a5.png)

In X the window situation is pretty much the opposite. The widow will end up filling about 3/4 of my screen after unmaximizing. That's not great either but it's better than what happens in Wayland.

I've tried various hacks but I can't find anything that works very well. Of the 2 I like the X behavior better. It would be nice if the X and Wayland experiences were a little more consistent.

I will search to see if I can find an upstream bug report related to this or @TingPing if you know anyone in the know upstream maybe you could mention this to them.

I really think that this is something that should be addressed upstream in GNOME.

issues.title: Move the Player logic out of the main class
Switch to pure GObject for networking
issues.body:
We've talked about this a little in the past @TingPing but I've recently been playing around with Soup and have had some success with doing some Pure GObject networking. It's a baby step but checkout this Gist:

https://gist.github.com/JasonLG1979/a0691d08c02f20358dc27b5ecddf9270

It takes a http request header, data, proxy and all and returns the response bytes. I scabbed it into Pandora.py and it returns the same thing as the pure python code. So at some point in the near future I'd like to replace all of our network code with async GObject stuff. That would remove the need for GObjectWorker. The only real sticking point I think is pylast. But really as little of it that we use I could probably write a small "Glast" module?

issues.title: New Plugin Idea: 10 band Eq.
issues.body: Since a 10 band eq plugin is built into Gstreamer plugins-good https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/data/doc/gstreamer/head/gst-plugins-good-plugins/html/gst-plugins-good-plugins-equalizer-10bands.html the hardest part would be the UI(still not that hard ;P) my thought is to have a few basic presets and allow the user to save their own custom presets, pretty much like every other Eq in any other player. It also opens it up to a potentially interesting feature. We could have an option to link a station to a Eq preset. So for example your hip hop station and classic country stations could have their own presets and they would change automatically as you changed to those stations.

issues.title: UX Papercuts
issues.body:
The purpose of this issue is to establish the existence of , discuss and track small relatively easily fixed user experience bugs. 

A couple guidelines:

1. This is not a place to request new features. We want to polish what we have here.

2. We will do our best to follow the GNOME HIG/design patterns but at the same time also do our best not to ruin the user experience in other Desktop Environments.

issues.title: Packagers Wanted
issues.body:
We currently need packagers. If you want an up to date version of Pithos for your distro of choice then roll up your sleeves and get involved. Become a Pithos packager.

Pithos requires at least Gtk 3.18 + GLib 2.46.

So far the following Distros are covered:
Ubuntu (16.04 - 17.04)
Arch
Fedora

Prefs design

After playing around with rewriting our notifications and adding options to the notify plugin it seems to me that the plugins section of the prefs ui could use a little tweaking. I propose something like this:

3. do the stuff I talked about in https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/344

issues.title: Proper Ad support
issues.body:
Reading up on the docs and poking though pandora.py I believe I've come up with proper ad support for Pithos. Turns out we were skipping ads all alone. Every playlist for free users contains a "song" that just contains an adToken. We were skipping it by checking for 'songName' in the playlist values.

Proper ad support has it's pluses and minuses.

On the plus side you can actually see ads in the playlist before they play, we would be supporting Pandora's revenue stream(no Pandora, no Pithos) since the ads can be "registered" so Pandora knows you heard them and hopefully as a side effect of that we could get less ads masquerading as songs.

On the minus side it would probably mean more ads for free users(Pandora One users never get ads). As I said before so far in my tests there's been an ad in just about every playlist.(so every 5th track), although there's still nothing to stop people from skipping them if they want.

Here's a screenshot of an upcoming ad in the playlist of my testing free account.

![screenshot from 2016-04-17 05-28-21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/14586485/4ddc1c0a-045f-11e6-9d2b-ff9805fab680.png)

issues.title: Extend plugin interface
issues.body:
I know the plans are to eventually allow for the loading of user/3rd party plugins. I might try to implement this in the future. My thought is that it should be pretty straight forward. (You can drop a plugin into Pithos right now and it'll work just fine if you know where to put it.) The user would open the prefs and in the plugins tab they'd click an "add plugin"(or whatever) button and Pithos would open a file dialog the user would select the plugin and Pithos would (try to) load it and save the plugin to a hidden folder somewhere in the user's home dir. And any 3rd party plugin would have a "remove" button by it to (you guessed it) delete it from said hidden folder and delete the pref values in gsettings.

My questions are:
Where would you like the "user plugins" folder to be?
And what are the "rules" as far as what a 3rd party plugin can do? Maybe some guidelines in the wiki?

issues.title: New UI Mockup
issues.body:
![mockup](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/13503521/6c793514-e135-11e5-86c2-77147c67547a.png)

It's been a while since I've brought it up. Since then all the major DE's have added support for headerbars. Those that don't support menus in the panel put them in a button on the headerbar(usually on the far left) This design leaves plenty of room for those menus and extra minimize and maximize buttons. It also falls more in line with the look of modern GNOME apps.

Since we can not seek the slider was replaced with a dual purpose progress bar that would show the track progress while playing and the buffer progress while buffering. 

My main inspiration was GNOME Music.

![music-screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6667703/13503738/bd86b318-e136-11e5-9058-90793cd54f4b.png)

song.title should not be a property

If song.title is a decorated property with a getter that means that the 1st thing to access it has to potentially do a blocking network call. It just so happens that the 1st thing to access song.title does so from the main thread. Doing blocking calls from the main thread is ofc bad. This instead moves checking the title to init to make sure that any blocking calls are done from a worker thread.

We don't have to lie about being able to seek any longer

The visibility of the position slider in https://github.com/JasonLG1979/gnome-shell-extensions-mediaplayer was decoupled from the CanSeek prop a while ago. As long as a Player provides a length in the metadata and can provide a valid postion the slider is visible. CanSeek determines if the slider is reactive. For Pithos that means the slider is visible but can't be moved by the user.

Only emit metadata changed signals if we have to.

Metadata is the most "expensive" property to deal with for clients. This cuts our Metadata updates to the bare minimum.

Don't GoTo songs that are banned or tired.

A user shouldn't be able to GoTo a song that is banned or tired because Pithos will just skip that banned or tired song and play the next song. In the case the song is banned or tired it makes more sense to do nothing. It's more of an expected behaviour then playing a song that wasn't selected(the next song).

For now this particular commit fixes a bug where when enabling a plugin with a prefs window the prefs button is not sensitive until you click off somewhere else and back on that plugin. Show dialog when trying to add station with existing seed.

As mentioned in https://github.com/pithos/pithos/issues/385 Pandora does not allow multiple stations with the same seed. If you try to create a station with an existing seed it will fail and Pandora will just return the station containing the exsisting seed. currently we do not check for this and we blindly just add the station to the station model, which if it already exsists leads to a duplicate station. This fixes that by checking if the returned station already exsists and if it does it pops up a dialog telling the user that a new station could not be created and gives them the option to listen to the exsisting station that contains the seed they were trying to use to create a new station with.

Improved buffering behavior

This improves buffering behavior in a few ways.

1st, It changes how we deal with buffering signals. Since the buffering percent that is received in the buffering message is pretty much useless this uses a buffering query to get a bool representing if the pipeline is buffering or not. We then respond to that bool accordingly.

2nd, It Enumerates the player states to give us a BUFFERING state. We can then use those Enums to clearly differentiate between PAUSED and BUFFERING.

3rd, It makes the timeout longer in souphttpsrc to give the user time to reconnect in the case of a network disconnect.

And finally it makes Pithos behave as you would expect during buffering as far as user initiated state changes. As in the pipeline doesn't actually change state until buffering completes at which time it goes to the correct state, whatever that may be.

Another positive side effect of this is that it puts the end to the UI thrashing during buffering.

Fix Ubuntu using last cover in the event that we have no cover.

Currently Ubuntu's Unity DE(and possibly other DE's) will reuse the last
cover if we don't get a cover from Pandora instead of using audio-x-generic
like it's suppose to. This fixes that.

Closes #285

Fixe high cpu usage for some themes

This feature was supposed to keep the current
song always appearing selected but it doesn't
work on most themes, is confusing from a UX
perspective, and caused performance problems
on some themes (Ubuntu's). So just remove it.

Fixes #281
Closes #282

MPRIS: Various improvements and workarounds

- General clean up
- New signals specifically for MPRIS
- Fixed volume slider scaling in sound applets
- Fixed volume sliders not staying in sync
- Mapped Pithos ratings to something MPRIS understands
- Added Position support

Closes #269
Closes #268

Use inconsistent checkbutton when syncing explicit filter

Mentioned in #250

Added the Explicit Content Filter option to preferences

Closes #250
Closes #181

Map stop to pause in mpris

And fixed a tiny typo.

update_song_row may as well always return True

update_song_row may as well always return True since we manually create and destroy the UI update loop and since self.paying is now a 3 way switch.

Removing unnecessary stuff 

We can set self.playing to None in stop. No need to do it in start_song
Stop "Paused" message from showing up during buffering.

Disable download buffering

Disable download buffering to avoid deadlocks in Gstreamer.

pull_requests.title: Move player logic out of main
pull_requests.body: Still a wip at the moment but I wanted to put in the PR so we could polish it up. currently this PR creates a custom player pipeline and abstracts as much out as possible as far as I can tell. It removes pretty much all gstreamer code from pithos.py. The proxy support and auto plugin install still needs tested.

``` python
    def sync_explicit_content_filter_setting(self, *ignore):
        #reset checkbox to default state
        self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_label('Explicit Content Filter')
        self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_sensitive(False)

        if self.pandora.connected:
            def get_filter_and_pin_protected_state(*ignore):
                current_filter_state = self.pandora.explicit_content_filter_state
                self.filter_state = current_filter_state[0]
                pin_protected = current_filter_state[1]
                return pin_protected

            def sync_checkbox(pin_protected):
                self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_active(self.filter_state)
                if pin_protected:
                    self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_label('Explicit Content Filter - PIN Protected')
                else:
                    self.prefs_dlg.explicit_content_filter_checkbutton.set_sensitive(True)

            self.worker_run(get_filter_and_pin_protected_state, (), sync_checkbox)
```

The string is the MPRIS trackId. It contains the required '/org/mpris/MediaPlayer2/TrackList/' + song_index + a random string of letters and numbers. The trackid must be unique as per the MPRIS docs. It's how MPRIS clients refer to the song. For example ' /org/mpris/MediaPlayer2/TrackList/1D5VDR0XZ6PDlfoD4QppsZesf6AXOjK0hCLzVDPIgHqARoAXcPn3Ekw49'. self._song_index_from_trackid takes the trackid and turns it back to a song index for the purpose of rating the song.
The trackId is also used through out MPRIS for it's playlist and tracklist interfaces and to tell if the song has changed.

self._valid_trackids is a list of valid trackid's. They are checked against in the rating method and cleared on the 'playlist-cleared' signal. At the moment we don't implement the tracklist interface but in the future if/when we do this will allow us to rate any song in the playlist not just the currently playing song.

issues.body: There are situations where AppIndicator is worse than GtkStatusIcon for example with legacy trays it doesn't support scrolling. A simple option would be nice.

issues.title: Improve acessibility
issues.body:
This is just a tracking issue making sure everything is tested. We need to ensure the entire application is navigable without sight or mouse input.

Some of this was done in 58b01fcb770edefd70ee5ec400676c4b8c4faa23 but this needs to happen for every window. Keyboard shortcuts are currently broken too because we override space and enter for everything in the main window.

issues.title: Make use of lastfm provider in Gnome Online Accounts
issues.body:
Would be nice to integrate with Gnome better on this one, pretty easy to do but the way we currently handle preference dialogs doesn't allow this to be cleanly done I don't think.

Snippet from gnome-music:

``` python
    def _check_last_fm(self):
        try:
            self.last_fm = None
            gi.require_version('Goa', '1.0')
            from gi.repository import Goa
            client = Goa.Client.new_sync(None)
            accounts = client.get_accounts()

            for obj in accounts:
                account = obj.get_account()
                if account.props.provider_name == "Last.fm":
                    self.last_fm = obj.get_oauth2_based()
                    return
        except Exception as e:
            logger.info("Error reading Last.fm credentials: %s" % str(e))
            self.last_fm = None
```

To prompt adding a new account one can launch the control center like:

``` sh
gnome-control-center online-accounts add - lastfm
# Note: The - is there because of a counting error? Fix upstream...
# Also probably activatable from dbus
```

Ok this is like 7 completely unrelated changes so I'll go down the list of my very basic opinions and you can open separate pull requests.
- **Unity Stuff**: Throws errors on my system without Unity, haven't tested with it.
- **Downloading Songs**: I don't want this, Pandora does not allow this functionality (for obvious reasons) and neither will we within the core, write a plugin for that if you want. Also mutagen doesn't support Python 3 anyway.
- **Back Button**: Same as previous point really, though I am less opinionated on it.
- **Progress Bar**: I like this but I am not a huge fan of the design of it.
- **Other UI Changes**: I don't see the purpose of the reload button really or making the window larger.

> you could show at the first launch a popup that says something like "do not use it", so that you are virtually ok with Pandora Media

No, downloading songs directly from Pandora will never be _OK_ for them.

As for the others, once you have these features in their own branches we can discuss them in more detail =)

pandora.py:

``` python
        self.connected = True
```

Only talking with the Pandora API should be ran in a thread, these calls are modifying the UI from a thread, big no-no.

>  The art_worker modifies the UI from a thread?

Nope, it calls `art_callback` on the main thread.

> I know that's why I was using GLib.idle_add and not the worker but you told me to use the worker?

Right you can't block the UI but you can't modify the UI from a thread either, thankfully worker has this callback system that does work in a thread but calls back to the UI thread when done.
Since `fn1()` is a noop you can just move your logic out of `callback1()`.

You don't need to store the return value of `fn2()` what is returned is directly passed to `callback2()` that you are ignoring. The second arg should be an empty tuple `()` to keep consistent. Also please pick remotely descriptive names for functions. Otherwise the usage here seems correct.

Pass the current state as an arg here instead of touching the UI from `fn()`.

Same comment about useful function names.
Minor nit-pick, but to be consistent remove `_to()` from the setter.

You should not be touching any Gtk api from any thread other than the main thread, this includes just reading from it.

With any external resource you have to remember that your running a multi-process system, between two calls in your program the keyring can change state. This is uncommon of course but there is no reason to not handle edge cases.
`'Systemd Python module not found'`
Missing a `\n` on all of these. Should move it to a helper function like so: https://github.com/lutris/lutris/blob/master/lutris/gui/application.py#L132-L135
Maybe we should print a message when no logs are found (like the plugin being disabled).
Translate the label portion.
Use `Gtk.ComboBoxText` perhaps.
`_('string')` and add the file to `po/POTFILES.in`.

issues.title: Station Drop menu doesn't work - Ubuntu 17.10 (on Wayland)
issues.body: Have Ubuntu 17.10, and after installing Pithos from it's PPA, I find I am unable to change the station, clicking on the station drop down menu, does nothing. Everything else thus far seems to work though. On the default Wayland session.

issues.title: Frequent skips during playback
issues.body: I've started to notice frequent skips in audio during playback, running Pithos 1.4.0 on Ubuntu 17.10.  They're short, maybe a quarter of a second, and seem to occur randomly, maybe once a minute or so.  I'm not sure where to even begin in terms of debugging this issue.  Has anyone seen any similar behaviour?  Is this likely a buffering issue?  I can't imagine it's a network connection problem.  I don't notice any CPU spikes or anything when this happens, either.  Suggestions welcome.

issues.title: Pithos stops playing at beginning of random song Raspberry Pi
issues.body:
Hello there. I am still having this issue. Here are some details:
- Pithos v1.2.1
- Raspberry Pi 2
- Ubuntu Mate 16.04
- Wired ethernet connection and I have tried WiFi connection. Both connections 50+ mbps lines.
- Pandora account not One subscription.

issues.title: Pandora One, yet shows Commercial Break as song title occaisonally
issues.body:
Second time seeing this, will update if I am more confident about how to reproduce. I have Pandora One, so I do not get commercials. But I have attached screen shot showing the song Land Down Under by the Avalanches was renamed to Commercial Advertisement by Pandora. Clicking Song Info shows the correct info by opening the Pandora song info page for that song. 

The image attached attempts to show the difference. 

Steps I will try later to reproduce:
1. Suspend (running Ubuntu) while Pithos is running but paused.
2. Wake up, log in, unpause pithos.
3. Pithos will stop playing, sometimes in the middle of a song. I am thinking this is related to me using Suspend, and when it stops I change the station, plays normally. (This could be already documented issue, only have searched for commercial related issues before this post.)
4. In this case I changed the station once, then changed the station almost right away to Avalanches
5. First song right away shows Commercial Advertisement

Also, I doubt this should effect anything, but the song in question is only 0:34 seconds long. Closer to a commercial than a full song. 

I'm experienced with Python, not so much with Pithos code yet, but I'm open to investigating this further if anyone has hints / direction / ideas. The only plugin im using is Notify. I have the Pandora One box checked. No proxy, no explicit content filter, Audio quality High.

issues.title: Multiple issues with notification area icon under MATE
issues.body:
Several behaviors of the notification area icon (at least under the MATE desktop) changed in a negative way with Pithos 1.1.2:
- left-click on the icon used to toggle the window being visible or not, now it just brings up the same context menu as right-click
- hovering on the icon used to show the current song info, now does nothing
- using the mouse scroll wheel on the icon used to adjust the application volume up or down (depending on scroll direction); now it adjusts the system volume instead and it always goes up (no matter the scroll direction)

This is all on Fedora 23. Installing Pithos 1.1.1 instead brings back the old behavior, so it doesn't appear to be directly tied to OS/desktop environment changes.

issues.title: Strange issue with playback stoppage and audio quality
issues.body:
I apologize in advance because this bug report is going to be very nebulous. I don't have much (really, any) data at this point, but would like to work with you to debug this problem.

issues.title: Warn user if throttling might be occurring
issues.body:
Users often do not realize that certain behavior causes "throttling" (purposefully reducing bandwidth on the part of Pandora) to occur. Further, from a user-perspective it might not be clear whether throttling is happening or whether there is a bug in Pithos. For related discussion, see #113.

Note that I have a Pandora One account and do not skip many songs so I have not experienced throttling. This is just to say that I will not be able to test any patches for this feature.

Merge pull request #202 from JasonLG1979/JasonLG1979-patch-3

update_song_row may as well always return True

Merge pull request #197 from JasonLG1979/patch-3

Removing unnecessary stuff

Merge pull request #196 from JasonLG1979/patch-2

Stop "Paused" message from showing up during buffering.
bump version to 1.1.1
increase logging verbosity in debug mode
removed buffer-size setting, as it doesn't seem to have an effect.
added buffer handling debug logging

Fix user pause when buffering.

Previous commit broke user pausing while buffering. Fixed.
Adding some debug logging to make the flow very clear.

Buffering fixes.

* Pithos was setting gstreamer to PLAY state initially.
  Gstreamer docs recommend starting playbin in PAUSED state
  and waiting for the buffer to fill before PLAYING. Fixed.

* Removed unnecessary if statement in on_gst_buffering.

* Manually set the gstreamer buffer size to 3 seconds at 192kbps.
  This is more than needed for 64bit AACs, but the only downside
  to a larger buffer is a bit of a pause at the beginning of a
  song (depending on network speed, latency, etc.)
Bump version to 1.1.0

issues.body: The list of starred tracks is very useful info.  It'd be great to access this info in one big view or grouped by station.  Also, exporting this info to the clipboard or txt would be great too.

issues.body:
So, I was going to try to help add this, but I've never used GTK and Glade has decided it won't open the ui files so I only have the barest idea of where the work would need to be done from reading the source.

Anyway, I would suggest rather than (or in addition to) Right Click -> Love Song (or Ban Song, etc), there be the canonical 'thumb up' and 'thumb down' icons in the bottom right corner of each song_treeview (I think that refers to each row/song, yes?).

issues.title: No support for SOCKS 5 proxies
issues.body:
Pithos doesn't support SOCKS 5 proxies because it automatically assumes a proxy is an HTTP proxy.

One consequence of this is that Tor can't be used with it, which deprives people outside the US (like people on vacation) of a way to listen to Pandora and which deprives people who want it of limited anonymity.

**_Note**_: it's easy to have Tor use only US exit nodes by putting `ExitNodes {us}` in `torrc` and restarting Tor.

I'm sorry, but I disagree. While better plugin support would be nice to have, proxy auto-configuration is usually something that is built into the core application and not something provided by a plugin. In addition to this, plugin support is implemented by providing hooks around general functionality in the core application that plugins can choose to override in order to provide additional functionality. I don't foresee a lot of third-party plugins centred around overriding Pithos's proxy configuration.

I'd rather package the pac-parsing module with Pithos if that would be a more acceptable solution, but I don't think rewriting this as a plugin would improve matters.
`pacparser` has a method named `parse_pac_string`, removing the need for a temporary file.

@gregsheremeta Yep, that's the dependency. I like @obadz's suggestion, because the pacparser module is written in C and wrapped in python, so I'm not sure how packaging it would work (package the compiled binary?), and rewriting it in pure python would be well beyond my python skills.

3. Display the error dialog if a PAC setting is found in preferences but the module is not found. This can happen if e.g. the user installs the module, sets a PAC and then removes the module. When this happens, automatically clear the PAC setting from preferences.

``` python
#!/usr/bin/python

import gtk

class StatusIcon:
    def scroll(x, y, steps):
        print 'Scroll - %s' % steps

    def __init__(self):
        self.statusicon = gtk.StatusIcon()
        self.statusicon.set_from_stock(gtk.STOCK_HOME) 
        self.statusicon.connect("popup-menu", self.right_click_event)
        self.statusicon.connect("scroll-event", self.scroll)
        self.statusicon.set_tooltip("StatusIcon Example")

        window = gtk.Window()

    def right_click_event(self, icon, button, time):
        menu = gtk.Menu()

        about = gtk.MenuItem("About")
        quit = gtk.MenuItem("Quit")

        about.connect("activate", self.show_about_dialog)
        quit.connect("activate", gtk.main_quit)

        menu.append(about)
        menu.append(quit)

        menu.show_all()

        menu.popup(None, None, gtk.status_icon_position_menu, button, time, self.statusicon)

    def show_about_dialog(self, widget):

        about_dialog.set_name("StatusIcon Example")
        about_dialog.set_version("1.0")

StatusIcon()
gtk.main()
```

After playing around a bit it seems that gi.require_version() doesn't work well with minor versions so I wrote this:

```
import gi
try:
    gi.require_version('Gst', '1.0')
except ValueError:
    #Tell the user the problem so they can fix it
    logging.error("Gstreamer 1.0 is required to run Pithos.")
    sys.exit()
from gi.repository import Gst, GObject, Gtk, Gdk, Pango, GdkPixbuf, Gio, GLib
#Check version of GTK
gtkVersion = str(Gtk.get_major_version())+"."+str(Gtk.get_minor_version())
gtkVersion = float(gtkVersion)
if gtkVersion <= 3.8:
    logging.error("GTK 3.8 or higher is required to run Pithos")
    sys.exit()
```

@JasonLG1979 
I think that's because you need to compile the gschema in the `meson_post_install.py`, `gnome.compile_schemas ()` used in `data/meson.build` is only used to compile locally in the current dir. So the schema is currently only being moved to the `[datadir]/glib-2.0/schemas` dir, not compiled.

Try adding adding the following under the `if not destdir:` block in `meson_post_install.py`:
```python
print ('Compiling GSettings schemas...')
schemas_dir = os.path.join (datadir, 'glib-2.0', 'schemas')
if not os.path.exists (schemas_dir):
    os.makedirs (schemas_dir)
subprocess.call (['glib-compile-schemas', '--strict', schemas_dir])
```

also updating the desktop cache might be a good idea:
```python
print ('Updating desktop database...')
desktop_database_dir = os.path.join (datadir, 'applications')
if not os.path.exists (desktop_database_dir):
    os.makedirs (desktop_database_dir)
subprocess.call (['update-desktop-database', '-q', desktop_database_dir])
```
